ezcox: Easy Group Cox Analysis and Visualization

Shixiang Wang  SYSUCC

2021-09-11

Source: vignettes/ezgroup.Rmd
ezgroup.Rmd
library(ezcox)
#> Welcome to 'ezcox' package!
#> =======================================================================
#> You are using ezcox version 1.0.0
#> 
#> Project home : https://github.com/ShixiangWang/ezcox
#> Documentation: https://shixiangwang.github.io/ezcox
#> 
#> Run citation("ezcox") to see how to cite 'ezcox'.
#> =======================================================================
#> 
library(survival)
ezcox_group(lung, grp_var = "sex", covariate = "ph.ecog")
#> => Processing variable 1
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> => Processing variable 2
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> covariates=NULL but drop_controls=TRUE, detecting controls...
#> No. Skipping...
#> Done.
#> Resized limits to included dashed line in forest panel
#> Returns a list containing data and ggplot.
#> $data
#> $stats
#> # A tibble: 2 × 13
#>   Group Variable is_control contrast_level ref_level n_contrast n_ref  beta
#>   <chr> <chr>    <lgl>      <chr>          <chr>          <int> <int> <dbl>
#> 1 1     ph.ecog  FALSE      1              1                137   137 0.426
#> 2 2     ph.ecog  FALSE      2              2                 90    90 0.637
#> # … with 5 more variables: HR <dbl>, lower_95 <dbl>, upper_95 <dbl>,
#> #   p.value <dbl>, global.pval <dbl>
#> 
#> $models
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   Group Variable control model_file                                 model status
#>   <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>                                      <lis> <lgl> 
#> 1 1     ph.ecog  <NA>    /var/folders/qx/5tqxhrrd5xd_n9rfbb_m5c200… <cox… TRUE  
#> 2 2     ph.ecog  <NA>    /var/folders/qx/5tqxhrrd5xd_n9rfbb_m5c200… <cox… TRUE  
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "ezcox"
#> 
#> $plot

ezcox_group(lung, grp_var = "sex", covariate = "ph.ecog", controls = "age")
#> => Processing variable 1
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> => Processing variable 2
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> covariates=NULL but drop_controls=TRUE, detecting controls...
#> Yes. Setting variables to keep...
#> Done.
#> Resized limits to included dashed line in forest panel
#> Returns a list containing data and ggplot.
#> $data
#> $stats
#> # A tibble: 4 × 13
#>   Group Variable is_control contrast_level ref_level n_contrast n_ref    beta
#>   <chr> <chr>    <lgl>      <chr>          <chr>          <int> <int>   <dbl>
#> 1 1     ph.ecog  FALSE      1              1                137   137  0.419 
#> 2 1     ph.ecog  TRUE       age            age              138   138  0.0184
#> 3 2     ph.ecog  FALSE      2              2                 90    90  0.714 
#> 4 2     ph.ecog  TRUE       age            age               90    90 -0.0112
#> # … with 5 more variables: HR <dbl>, lower_95 <dbl>, upper_95 <dbl>,
#> #   p.value <dbl>, global.pval <dbl>
#> 
#> $models
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   Group Variable control model_file                                 model status
#>   <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>                                      <lis> <lgl> 
#> 1 1     ph.ecog  age     /var/folders/qx/5tqxhrrd5xd_n9rfbb_m5c200… <cox… TRUE  
#> 2 2     ph.ecog  age     /var/folders/qx/5tqxhrrd5xd_n9rfbb_m5c200… <cox… TRUE  
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "ezcox"
#> 
#> $plot

ezcox_group(lung, grp_var = "sex", covariate = "ph.ecog", controls = "age", add_all = TRUE)
#> => Processing variable 1
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> => Processing variable 2
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> => Processing variable ALL
#> ==> Building Surv object...
#> ==> Building Cox model...
#> ==> Done.
#> covariates=NULL but drop_controls=TRUE, detecting controls...
#> Yes. Setting variables to keep...
#> Done.
#> Resized limits to included dashed line in forest panel
#> Returns a list containing data and ggplot.
#> $data
#> $stats
#> # A tibble: 6 × 13
#>   Group Variable is_control contrast_level ref_level n_contrast n_ref    beta
#>   <chr> <chr>    <lgl>      <chr>          <chr>          <int> <int>   <dbl>
#> 1 1     ph.ecog  FALSE      1              1                137   137  0.419 
#> 2 1     ph.ecog  TRUE       age            age              138   138  0.0184
#> 3 2     ph.ecog  FALSE      2              2                 90    90  0.714 
#> 4 2     ph.ecog  TRUE       age            age               90    90 -0.0112
#> 5 ALL   ph.ecog  FALSE      ALL            ALL              227   227  0.443 
#> 6 ALL   ph.ecog  TRUE       age            age              228   228  0.0113

#> #   p.value <dbl>, global.pval <dbl>
#>
